thread.title: Three Florida festivals to mark the end of summer
thread.title_full: Three Florida festivals to mark the end of summer | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Mary Thurwachter
title: Three Florida festivals to mark the end of summer
text:
Summer is quickly coming to an end, and that means it’s time for Gulfport’s 15th annual Geckofest. The wacky arts and entertainment festival pays homage to the beachside town’s favorite reptile.
This year, nine local artists have created larger-than-life geckos to be auctioned off with benefits going to local charity.
In Gulfpost, near St. Petersburg, residents and tourists pay tribute to the town’s favorite reptile during Geckofest. Contributed Besides the street festival on Sept. 5, the party includes a Gecko Ball, a celebration of Mardi Gras and its colorful traditions, on Aug. 29. A Gecko Pub Crawl was already held on Aug. 8.
Festival admission is free. For more information, visit www.Geckofest.com .
Grape-stomping in Clermont
The Lakeridge Winery and Vineyards in Clermont will be home to the 20th annual Harvest Grape Stomp on Saturday and Sunday. Contributed The Lakeridge Winery and Vineyards in Clermont will be home to the 20th annual Harvest Grape Stomp on Saturday and Sunday. The party marks the harvest season and boasts continuous live music, wine, beer, soft drinks, food and complimentary winery tours and tastings.
Admission is a $2 donation to the Boys & Girls Club.
Lakeridge Winery & Vineyards opened in 1989 and sits on a 127-acre estate 25 miles west of downtown Orlando. The area was once the center of Florida’s grape industry.
There will be live entertainnment at the Great Southern Tailgate Classic, and football fans will show off their tailgate talents. Contributed For more information, visit www.lakeridgewinery.com .
Kicking off football season on Amelia Island
As summer comes to an end, it’s time to get ready for the football season. In Fernandina Beach, on Amelia Island, that happens in a big way with the annual Great Southern Tailgate Classic on the beach on Aug. 21-22.
A Tailgate Challenge will have teams showing off their tailgating food, beverages, tailgate décor and team spirit. Team mascots will compete, too, and can help their teams win the challenge.
A pep rally with live entertainment will be Aug. 21. Events include a drumline showdown, punt challenge, cooking demonstrations and even a rock-paper-scissors competition. Bands will perform all day on Saturday.
Gates open at 5 p.m. on Aug. 21 and 10 a.m. on Aug. 22. The event will be on the main beach at 2 N. Fletcher Ave. Tickets are $25. Free parking and shuttle service is available. For more details, visit www.greatsoutherntailgateclassic.com .
